title: Comparing approximations by various Riemann sums

content.question: The graph of the function f is shown above for <math> <mrow> <mn> 0 </mn> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mi> x </mi> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mn> 3 </mn> </mrow> </math> . Of the following, which has the least value?

choices.label: Left Riemann sum approximation of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F92@</annotation> </semantics> </math> with 4 subintervals of equal length

Right Riemann sum approximation of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F92@</annotation> </semantics> </math> with 4 subintervals of equal length

Midpoint Riemann sum approximation of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F92@</annotation> </semantics> </math> with 4 subintervals of equal length

Trapezoidal sum approximation of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F92@</annotation> </semantics> </math> with 4 subintervals of equal length

content.answer: Right Riemann sum approximation of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F92@</annotation> </semantics> </math> with 4 subintervals of equal length

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
